captions.text: - Well hello, everyone!

My name is Tyler Oakley
and I feel like it has been

for ever since I have
been in my own apartment,
which is the weirdest thing in the world.
I was just in North Carolina, and Ohio,
and Chicago working on a secret project,
and now I'm here for a week before I go

and head on over to New
York to play the tri-state.
Then I go to Michigan for Thanksgiving,
then I go to Florida for an awards show,
and then I go to California back to record
some podcast episodes, then I go on my
Tyler Oakley tour, which I hope
that you guys can come to.
I'm coming to New York City, New Jersey,
Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania, Michigan,
Rhode Island, and Massachusetts.
So if you want to come to the shows,
I would get tickets immediately.
The shows are going to sell out quickly.
You can go to tyleroakleytour.com
to see all the details.
But yes, I cannot wait to see you guys,
and meet you guys, and hug you guys,

and take selfies, and
everything like that,
so get your tickets now.
Then after the slumber party tour,
I'm going on more adventures,

which you guys will find
out about soon enough.
But while I am back here in California,
I was like, I want to sit down,
get in front of the camera, and talk to

you guys about what
I've been loving lately
because I want you guys to get in
on what I am absolutely in love with.

So this month I have a couple
favorites for you guys.
I feel like this favorite has been
a recurring favorite for a while now,
and it is Tiger beat because they are
giving me some love.
I am in the magazine again this month
if you want to pick it up.
Let me find myself.
I am looking cute.
Where am I?
There I am!

Here I am in a picture that
I never really tweeted,
maybe I'll tweet it right now.
It's in Tiger beat.
Pick it up.
Let me know if you get it.
Send me a selfie, and yeah, I'll be
giving you guys love if you do.
Another thing that I like that I think

nobody will care about is
this magnet kitchen timer.
I got it from Anthropology.
I love Anthropology.

This might be one of my
favorite hair colors,

so that's probably what
attracted me to it,
but I love it.
It's like ding-a-linging.
Can you hear it?

With all my traveling,
I am always snacking
on the go and trying to be healthy,
and this month I am recommending,
as you guys know I recommend a new snack
every month from NatureBox,

I am recommending sour
cream and onion almonds.
They are so delicious and somehow healthy.
They're like trans-fat free,
and low in calories, and good for you,
and stuff like that.
If you want to get some healthy snacks,

all you got to do is go
to naturebox.com/tyler.

If you use that link, you
will get a whole bunch

of free snacks, so who
does not like free snacks?
Healthy foods, inexpensive, they show up
to your front door, you order them online.
It's basically a monthly service,
and it's the best thing ever.
Again, naturebox.com/tyler.
You're welcome in advance.

Also, at Anthropology
I got another candle.
I love candles, so.
This is, what is the flavor?
Amaretto orange, and it smells delicious.
Some music that I'm loving right now.
I am obviously loving Taylor Swift's
brand new album, 1989.
As you guys know from the podcast episode
that I dedicated to all of the episode
to Taylor Swift to celebrate 1989,
I am obsessed with the album.

I think it's really
good and I specifically
am loving Bad Blood, I love Blank Space,
I love How You get the Girl,
I love All you Had to was Stay.
There's a lot of songs on the album
that I'm absolutely obsessed with.
So go pick it up.

I am also loving,
obviously, Cheek to Cheek
by Lady Gaga and Tony Bennet.
I just picked up the vinyl of it
because I was like, you know what,

jazz always sounds so
good on a record player.
So I picked it up.
It does not disappoint, I really dig it.
So if you want to get the album,

I highly recommend
getting the vinyl version
because it sounds good with the crackle
of a record player.

And it puts me in the
mood for Christmas music,
which I absolutely am here for it,
so get it.

Another super cute thing
that I am absolutely
digging right now are these.

I guess they're called
Eastern Collective USB cables,
and they're for my iPhone.

I always have a problem
whenever I am traveling
not knowing whose cords are whose,
so I have these when I'm on the road,
and I can easily tell these are mine
because they are adorable.
They sent these to me and I was like,
oh my God!
I'm actually in love with them.
So if you want to get them,
the link to them will be below.
Also, I have to talk about one of my
favorite videos right now.
It is the woman talking about why Monster
energy drinks are of the devil.
She is my everything.
I am obsessed with her.
The link to that is below.
And another viral video that I'm really
into right now is Pentatonix members
Mitch and Scott.

They have their own
channel called Superfruit.
They did a huge mash up of 1989
and it's so good.
I'm going to link to that below.
And as far as viral videos go,
I have to tell you guys
about my favorite video right now.
Not just the one about the woman
with the energy drinks, but also there's
a woman who is talking about why she
is on #teamlittledick.

I can't even explain it,
you have to watch it.
The link to it is below.
Literal queen.
(laughs) It's like so much.
Last time I showed you a hat that I'm
currently loving, and this time I'm going
to show you another hat
because I am digging this one.

It's kind of like I'm
like a witch of some sort,

and I kind of dig it, and
it's like I don't know.
I've been wearing it out and about
and I feel super cute in it.
So I'm just going with it.

And last time I did my
favorite things video
I showed you guys a marker and everybody
made fun of me, and I was like,

you know what, I can't help
it that I love markers,

and I just ordered, ya'll
are going to love it
because I love it so much.
Oh my God, oh my God, I'm so excited.
I just ordered a whole fuck ton more,
so deal with it.
(laughs)
Honestly, you guys do not understand.
For Christmas ya'll are ordering posters
up the wazoo, and I have been signing
a whole bunch of them.
I have a stack over there,
three boxes of these posters.
And my markers run out,
and so these markers are the best.
They're so good that I'm including them
in, not just last month's favorites,
but this month's favorites,
so not even sorry about it.
Speaking of the holidays,
I have a brand new sweater in my store.

If you want to get it,
it will be available

so that you can get it
in time for the holidays

and give it as a gift,
or anything that you want
from the store, whether it's iPhone cases,
or sweaters, or posters, or t-shirts.

Honestly, everything in
my District Lines store

makes the perfect gift for
the holidays, just saying.
Good story Tyler!

I'm full of good stories,
not even sorry about it.

But yes, that is all I
have for you guys today.
I hope you have a fabulous life.
If you'd like to see my latest video,
it's right there.

It's about the time that
I crashed a homecoming.
It was insane, so go watch that.
If you want to hear my latest podcast,
click right there.
It's the best one yet.
If you want to be my person of the week,
click right there.

And if you want to
subscribe, click right there
or the link right there.
But yeah, I hope you have a fabulous life,
and I will see you guys next time.
Later!.
And if you're still watching,

go down to the very
bottom of the description

of this video and click
the link to tell me
where I should come on tour.
I want to know.

Click that link right
now and then tweet me
where I should come.
Okay, bye.

comments.author: RainbowLemonChannel

comments.text:
About the Superfruit video: mixed feelings. I've honestly seen Pentatonix 
do better. They botched up the rhythm on I Know Places... But their 
rendition of Out Of The Woods, Bad Blood and Clean were awesome. I just 
prefer it when they stick to accapella. They didn't spend long enough on 
any of the songs to do them justice, especially How You Get The Girl, but I 
really liked the finale. The whole thing must have taken an immense amount 
of work to write, perform, edit and altogether put together. I thought the 
stringing together was really good apart from the songs being skipped or 
skimmed. They're really talented, I loved the beatbox! It needs to be said 
that it's impossible to sum up the entirety of the epic-ness that is 1989 
in only 3 minutes and 54 seconds... but hey tried :D﻿
